title: Belgian billionaire Frere to sell Burberry stake
text:
May 8, 2018 / 7:11 PM / Updated 17 minutes ago Belgian billionaire Frere to sell Burberry stake Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
(Reuters) - Albert Frere is selling his entire stake in Burberry ( BRBY.L ), the Belgian billionaire’s Groupe Bruxelles Lambert (GBL) said on Tuesday, after a period of management upheaval at the British fashion house. Belgium businessman Albert Frere leaves the Elysee Palace in Paris, October 29, 2008. REUTERS/Philippe Wojazer (FRANCE)
Proceeds from the disposal would help GBL to pursue new investments and rebalance its portfolio, it said in the statement without elaborating. FILE PHOTO: The exterior of a Burberry store is seen in central London, Britain, November 3, 2017. Picture taken November 3, 2017. REUTERS/Toby Melville/File Photo
Burberry, famed for its trench coats and trademark check in camel, red and black, recently parted company with Christopher Bailey, the designer who turned it into a global brand and later became CEO, and last year appointed Marco Gobbetti as its new CEO as the group seeks to kick-start sales growth.
Frere’s stake is owned by GBL subsidiary GBL Energy, which also has investments in French drinks company Pernod Ricard ( PERP.PA ) and oil major Total ( TOTF.PA ).
GBL and GBL Energy said they would sell their Burberry stake of about 6.6 percent through a private placement, with Goldman Sachs acting as the bookrunner.
Burberry shares closed at almost 18.85 pence on Tuesday, up about 0.5 percent. Reporting by Ismail Shakil in Bengaluru; Editing by David Goodman
